intro: Antimima klaverensis, commonly known as the Klaver's antelope plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to store water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Antimima klaverensis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
